result.execSummary:
The defendant Sara A Waldner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for David K. ($190.00) if not already paid, and for Jason M ($37.50) from read-in list, to be paid as a condition of probation.  To be paid before costs or fines.

Cost to be paid as a condition of probation.    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Comply with random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.  No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed/sign releases.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with Victim businesses listed in criminal complaint and read-in list nor with David K. or with Jason M.
 If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: read-in list filed by the state

Defendant Sara A Waldner in court, in custody, with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files read-in list.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Repeater enhancer is struck.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION: 1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim businesses listed in criminal complaint and read-in list nor with David K. or with Jason M. 

RESTITUTION:  $190.00 to David K. (if not already paid) and $37.50 to Jason M. (from read-in case) (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court.   Defendant Sara A Waldner did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rumpf requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court.   Defendant Sara A Waldner did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rumpf requests an adjournment as she just received discovery.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.
